meanings.definition: To begin or set out on a journey or course.
meanings.sent1: I will start my homework after dinner.
meanings.sent2: The race will start at 9 am sharp.
meanings.sent3: Let's start our adventure with a map and compass.
meanings.sent4: Her smile was the starting point of his happiness.
meanings.sent5: The first step is always the hardest when you start something new.

meanings.definition: To come into being or have its beginning.
meanings.sent1: Plants start to grow in the spring.
meanings.sent2: The idea for the project started during a brainstorming session.
meanings.sent3: The friendship between them started with a simple hello.
meanings.sent4: The sun starting to rise painted the sky in beautiful colors.
meanings.sent5: Every story has to start somewhere, even if it's just a single word.

meanings.sent1: I didn't mean to startle you with my sudden entrance.
meanings.sent2: The loud noise made the cat start and run away.
meanings.sent3: The unexpected clap of thunder made him start in surprise.
meanings.sent4: The sudden burst of laughter made her startle and drop her book.
meanings.sent5: The unexpected touch on her shoulder made her start and turn around quickly.
